intro: Eschscholzia helleriana, commonly known as Heller's poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking red to orange petals and a slender, erect stem. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. Its flowers bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eschscholzia helleriana is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
